intro: Pluchea tomentosa, commonly known as woolly groundsel, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features hairy, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Pluchea tomentosa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
